org.simplity.gateway

Interface RespWriter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JsonObjectRespWriter, JsonRespWriter, ProtoRespWriter

    public interface RespWriter
    Author:
    simplity.org

    • Method Detail

      • setAsResponse

        void setAsResponse(Object responseObject)
        use this as the response object. If used, typically this is the only call before a writeOut() call.
        Parameters:
        responseObject -

      • setField

        void setField(String fieldName,
              Value value)
        write a field as attribute-value pair. Simplity deals with primitives as Value objects, and hence a specific method for this. use object() to set non-value attributes
        Parameters:
        fieldName -
        value -

      • setField

        void setField(String fieldName,
              Object value)
        write a field as attribute-value pair. Simplity deals with primitives as Value objects, and hence a specific method for this. use object() to set non-value attributes
        Parameters:
        fieldName -
        value -

      • setObject

        void setObject(String fieldName,
               Object obj)
        A non-primitive object. Writer may reject object assignments that it does not know how to handle.
        Parameters:
        fieldName -
        obj -

              Object[] arr)

              DataSheet sheet)
        use the first column of the data sheet as an array
        Parameters:
        arrayName -
        sheet -

      • beginObject

        Object beginObject(String objectName)
        start name-object pair, and allow its attributes to be written out
        Parameters:
        objectName -
        Returns:
        writer, so that methods can be cascaded

      • beginObjectAsArrayElement

        Object beginObjectAsArrayElement()
        start an object as an element of an array (hence no name)
        Returns:
        writer, so that methods can be cascaded

      • endObject

        Object endObject()
        close the last open object
        Returns:
        writer, so that methods can be cascaded

      • beginArray

        Object beginArray(String arrayName)
        begin an array as an attribute (hence name)
        Parameters:
        arrayName -
        Returns:
        writer, so that methods can be cascaded

      • beginArrayAsArrayElement

        Object beginArrayAsArrayElement()
        begin an array as an element of parent array (hence no name)
        Returns:
        writer, so that methods can be cascaded

      • endArray

        Object endArray()
        close the array
        Returns:
        writer, so that methods can be cascaded

      • addToArray

        void addToArray(Object value)
        write a field as an element of an array (hence no name). this is valid only when a beginArray() is active.
        Parameters:
        value -

      • getFinalResponseObject

        Object getFinalResponseObject()
        Returns:
        final response as specific object. writer is closed, if it is not already closed. You have to choose to use this method or getFinalResponseObject for optimal use by avoiding unnecessary serialization/de-serialization

      • writeout

        void writeout(OutputStream stream)
       throws IOException
        job is done. flush out.
        Parameters:
        stream - to which output should be flushed to. null if the writer is already bound to a stream.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • pullDataFromContext

        void pullDataFromContext(ServiceContext ctx)
        Service has delegated writing to this writer. write out response based on spec
        Parameters:
        ctx -

      • hasOutputSpec

        boolean hasOutputSpec()
        is this writer based on output specification so that it can select, and format required out put data
        Returns:
        true if it has details of output parameters. false if it is a pipe and service should take care of that

      • moveToObject

        Object moveToObject(String qualifiedFieldName)
        make this qualified field as the target object for all setXXX commands. fields of root objects have no prefix. child filed is prefixed with parentField and a dot. for example "orders.orderDetails". This array is created if required.
        Parameters:
        qualifiedFieldName -
        Returns:
        null if no object found with that field name, and it could not be created.

      • moveToArray

        Object moveToArray(String qualifiedFieldName)
        make this qualified field as the target array for all setXXX commands. fields of root objects have no prefix. child filed is prefixed with parentField and a dot. for example "orders.orderDetails". This array is created if required.
        Parameters:
        qualifiedFieldName -
        Returns:
        null if no object found with that field name, and it could not be created.

      • setAsCurrentObject

        void setAsCurrentObject(Object object)
        Use this as the current object.
        Parameters:
        object - typically an object that was returned earlier. Advanced users can use this to build different objects all together.

      • getCachingKey

        String getCachingKey()
        Returns:
        get the key based on which the response can be cached. emptyString means no key is used for caching. null means it can not be cached.

      • getCacheValidity

        int getCacheValidity()
        Returns:
        number of minutes the cache is valid for. 0 means it has no expiry. This method is relevant only if getCachingKey returns non-null (indication that the service can be cached)

      • setCaching

        void setCaching(String key,
                int minutes)
        Parameters:
        key - key based on which the response can be cached. emptyString means no key is used for caching. null means it can not be cached
        minutes - if non-null cache is to be invalidated after these many minutes

      • getInvalidations

        String[] getInvalidations()
        Returns:
        cached keys that need to be invalidated

      • setInvalidations

        void setInvalidations(String[] invalidations)
        Parameters:
        invalidations - cached keys that need to be invalidated
